intro: Tapeinosperma amplexicaule, commonly known as the clasping tapeinosperma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often clasping, wrapping around the stems, which is a distinguishing botanical trait. It is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
